abstract: Two short films individually examine two seemingly disparate subjects and their respective influences on public space in 1960s and '70s American suburbia.
snippet: Two short films individually examine two seemingly disparate subjects and their respective influences on public space in 1960s and '70s American suburbia.
lead_paragraph: What do skateboarding and post-minimalist art have in common? More than you might guess, as will be revealed at the Emily Harvey Foundation in SoHo when Redmond Entwistle's "Monuments" (2009) and Raphael Zarka's "Species of Spaces in Skateboarding" (2008) screen together this week. These two short films individually examine two seemingly disparate subjects and their respective influences on public space in 1960s and '70s American suburbia.
